awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Analytical Approaches to Singular    Perturbation Problems of Significance to Applications
awd_abstract_narration: This research will study the asymptotic solution of nonline-               ar initial and boundary value problems involving systems of                     differential equations.  A characteristic of the solutions of                   these equations is that they exhibit rapid changes within thin                  regions.  Consequently, the asymptotic methods are able to make                 use of the presence of multiple scales.  Of particular interest                 in this research are problems involving boundary and interior                   layers.  The work is motivated by physical applications including               models which simulate the operation of semiconductor devices and                problems arising from optimal control.  Problems will be attacked               using a combined analytical and numerical approach.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
